title: How to Make a Healthy Fridge or Freezer Cake Slice

steps.headline: Beat together the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.
Add the creamed coconut (if it is solid, you will need to soak it in boiling water while still packaged).
Use a blender if you want to be quicker.
Add the carob or cocao powder ad honey.
Add as much oats and dried fruit as you want!
Make sure it is quite a thick consistency otherwise it won't work.
steps.description: If it is too thin, add some thickening agent, flour or more oats.

steps.headline: Line a baking tin with clingfilm and pour the mixture in the tin, spreading it evenly.
Place in the freezer for at least 4 hours.
Remove from freezer, slice into squares with a knife.
Eat immediately for a refreshing tropical treat, or leave in the fridge to eat later!

text: Beat together the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.  Add the creamed coconut (if it is solid, you will need to soak it in boiling water while still packaged).  Use a blender if you want to be quicker.  Add the carob or cocao powder ad honey.  Add as much oats and dried fruit as you want!  Make sure it is quite a thick consistency otherwise it won't work. If it is too thin, add some thickening agent, flour or more oats. Line a baking tin with clingfilm and pour the mixture in the tin, spreading it evenly.  Add a topping if desired.  Place in the freezer for at least 4 hours.  Remove from freezer, slice into squares with a knife.  Eat immediately for a refreshing tropical treat, or leave in the fridge to eat later!  Finished.
